headline.print_headline: Wash That Blog Out With Soap
headline.main: Wash That Blog Out With Soap

docs.snippet: Emma Koenig has a viral blog, a book out next month and a deal pending with a production company to develop a TV series — and she has finally moved out of her parents’ house....
docs.abstract: Emma Koenig, who has documented her hapless life of low-paying jobs and bad boyfriends in her viral blog F-ck! I'm in My Twenties, describes how her upcoming book and pending television series deal has enabled her to finally move out of her parents' house.
docs.lead_paragraph: Emma Koenig has a viral blog, a book out next month and a deal pending with a production company to develop a TV series — and she has finally moved out of her parents’ house.

headline.seo: On Gay Marriage, Europe Strains to Reconcile 27 Interests
headline.main: On Gay Marriage, Europe Strains to Square 27 Interests

docs.snippet: Europe prides itself on its open borders, but many gay couples leave their rights behind when they cross them because of the continent’s lingering differences on family law....

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Many gay couples in Europe find they are leaving their rights behind when they move from country to country for work, love or vacation, despite the fact that the Continent prides itself on its open borders; national differences on family laws are leading to practical difficulties in many areas, including taxes, parental rights and inheritances.
docs.lead_paragraph: Europe prides itself on its open borders, but many gay couples leave their rights behind when they cross them because of the continent’s lingering differences on family law.

headline.print_headline: Generic Rivals Cut Into Lilly and Bristol-Myers Profits
headline.seo: Eli Lilly and Bristol-Myers Profits Fall on Generic Drug Competition
headline.main: Generic Rivals Cut Into Lilly and Bristol-Myers Profits

docs.snippet: Eli Lilly beat profit forecasts, but both it and Bristol-Myers Squibb are struggling to make up for loses on several drugs that no longer have patent protection....
docs.abstract: Eli Lilly and Bristol-Myers Squibb both report earnings that reflect troubles faced as expiring patents and generic rivals cut into their profitable businesses; Eli Lilly beats forecasts, earning $924 million, or 83 cents a share, down from $1.2 billion, or $1.07 a share, in the period a year earlier; revenue fell 10 percent, to $5.6 billion; Bristol-Myers reports a net income of $808 million, or 38 cents a share, compared with $1.31 billion, or 52 cents a share, in the period a year earlier; revenue fell 18 percent, to $4.44 billion.
docs.lead_paragraph: Eli Lilly beat profit forecasts, but both it and Bristol-Myers Squibb are struggling to make up for loses on several drugs that no longer have patent protection.

headline.seo: Caterpillar Raises 2012 Forecast After Strong Profits

docs.snippet: The world’s largest maker of construction equipment raised its annual earnings forecast by a dime a share but beat second-quarter expectations by 26 cents....
docs.abstract: Caterpillar raises its 2012 profit forecast, saying the global economy is slowly improving amid pockets of weakness; company reports a profit of $1.67 billion, or $2.54 a share, compared with $1.02 billion, or $1.52 a share, a year ago; analysts on average expected earnings of $2.28 a share; revenue rose 21 percent to $17.37 billion, surpassing analysts' expectation of $17.11 billion.
docs.lead_paragraph: The world’s largest maker of construction equipment raised its annual earnings forecast by a dime a share but beat second-quarter expectations by 26 cents.

headline.print_headline: For Foursquare, It’s Not an Ad, It’s a Promoted Update
headline.seo: Foursquare to Test Paid Ads - Advertising
headline.main: For Foursquare, It’s Not an Ad, It’s a Promoted Update

docs.snippet: About 20 advertisers are taking part in the social media app’s pilot program to test paid ads. The program echoes the Promoted Tweets terminology used by Twitter....
docs.abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column on Foursquare's pilot program to test paid ads; roughly 20 advertisers are taking part in the experiment that is modeled after the Promoted Tweets strategy used by Twitter.
docs.lead_paragraph: About 20 advertisers are taking part in the social media app’s pilot program to test paid ads. The program echoes the Promoted Tweets terminology used by Twitter.

headline.print_headline: A Studio With Violence in Its Bones
headline.seo: Warner Brothers and Its Decades of Violent Films
headline.main: A Studio With Violence in Its Bones

docs.snippet: For decades Warner Brothers films have put the studio in the middle of a debate over violence in the cinema and in real life....
docs.abstract: News analysis; Warner Brothers, a studio that has a history of producing violent films, is considering making significant changes to its upcoming movie Gangster Squad, or at least delaying its release, because film contains scenes that seem to recall the movie-theater shooting in Aurora, Colo.
docs.lead_paragraph: For decades Warner Brothers films have put the studio in the middle of a debate over violence in the cinema and in real life.

headline.print_headline: Setting a High Bar for Trinkets
headline.seo: For the Olympics, Artisanal Souvenirs, Inexpensive Yet Creative
headline.main: Setting a High Bar for Trinkets

docs.snippet: Five London designers have been commissioned to create artisanal Olympics souvenirs....

keywords.value: Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain
keywords.name: persons

docs.abstract: British arts organization Create London commissions five designers to create artisanal Olympics souvenirs as an alternative to shoddy mass-produced mementos, often made overseas, that have flooded the country; several other objects in the Create series provoke questions about the very act of remembering.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five London designers have been commissioned to create artisanal Olympics souvenirs.
